[[Image:G.H. Cowling 23 December 1934.pn: On [[23 December]] [[1934]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"

*'''Subject:''' Tolkien explains his procrastination and horror of writing letters. He thanks Cowling for a copy of Chaucer and wishes him a Happy Christmas.<ref name=Bay>[http://bayeastauctions.com.au/lot_details.php?lot=177951 The Art & Book Sale 27 November 2011, Lot No. 390] at [http://bayeastauctions.com.au/ BayEastAuctions.com.au] (accessed 26 November 2011)</ref> The letter is noteworthy for mentioning the name ''[[Bingo Baggins#Other versions of the Legendarium
thumb]]: Bingo]]'' in the postscript.<ref>[http://www.tolkienguide.com/modules/wordpress/archives/236#comments Signed Lord of the Rings, Reeve's Tale, Manuscript Letters for Auction Sunday Nov 27 in Australia] at [http://www.tolkienguide.com/ TolkienGuide.com] (accessed 26 November 2011)</ref>

[[Image:G.H. Cowling 23 December 1934.pn: *'''Description:''' Two page manuscript letter, [[20 Northmoor Road]] [[Oxford]].<ref name=Bay/>
